What is the primary function of the S1 s: It contains the receptor-binding domain (RBD) crucial for binding to the hACE2 receptor.
It facilitates the fusion of the viral and host cell membranes.
It anchors the spike protein to the viral membrane.
It is responsible for the trimerization of the spike protein.
What potential application is suggested: As inhaled drugs for treating respiratory diseases.
As oral vaccines for widespread immunization.
As topical ointments for skin protection.
As dietary supplements to boost immunity.
What unique feature allows nanobodies to: Their small size allows access to protein cavities that are otherwise inaccessible.
Their ability to undergo rapid affinity maturation.
Their capacity to bind multiple epitopes simultaneously.
Their enhanced stability at high temperatures.
